definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
(bound form used in 忙碌[mang2 lu4], 勞碌|劳碌[lao2 lu4], 庸碌[yong1 lu4] etc)

sentences.english: He tugged all the year round to feed and clothe his family.
sentences.chinese: 他終年爲全家提供衣食而勞碌。

sentences.english: All man's efforts are for his mouth, yet his appetite is never satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 衆人的勞碌都爲口腹，但心裏幾時滿足過。

sentences.english: He toiled all day long but earned very little.
sentences.chinese: 他整天勞碌但掙得很少。

sentences.english: Saturday's child works hard for its living;
sentences.chinese: 星期六出生的孩子是勞碌命。

sentences.english: Eccl 4:9 Two are better than one because they have a good return for their labor.
sentences.chinese: 兩個人總比一個人好，因爲二人勞碌同得美好的果效。

sentences.english: Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their work
sentences.chinese: 兩個人總比一個人好，因爲二人勞碌同得美好的果效。

sentences.english: But God has seen my hardship and the toil of my hands, and last night he rebuked you.
sentences.chinese: 上帝看見我的苦情和我的勞碌，就在昨夜責備你。

sentences.english: This too is a grievous evil: As a man comes, so he departs, and what does he gain, since he toils for the wind?
sentences.chinese: 他爲風勞碌有什麼益處呢？

sentences.english: The reporter is dry, labor life that is quite true.
sentences.chinese: 幹記者的就是勞碌命，此話不假。

sentences.english: Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.
sentences.chinese: 兩個人總比一個人好，因爲二人勞碌同得美好的果效。

sentences.english: Yes, I guess you could call me a real busy bee !
sentences.chinese: 對呀，我想你可以說我是個十足的勞碌命。

sentences.english: This must have been one of the proudest moments of his busy and hard working life.
sentences.chinese: 這一定是他勞碌工作的一生中最引以爲榮的時刻之一。

sentences.english: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;
sentences.chinese: 他將列國的地賜給他們，他們便承受衆民勞碌得來的。

sentences.english: For this is your lot in life and in your toilsome labor under the sun.
sentences.chinese: 因爲那是你一生在日光之下勞碌的事上所得的分。

sentences.english: Better one handful with tranquillity than two handfuls with toil and chasing after the wind.
sentences.chinese: 滿了一把，得享安靜，強如兩把齊抓，勞碌捕風。

sentences.english: God hath seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight.
sentences.chinese: 上帝看見我的苦情和我的勞碌，就在昨夜責備你。

definition: to be content with what one is
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
too busy/to have no time for/fully occupied
